skill.name: agent-tools
skill.description: Run 150+ AI apps via inference.sh CLI - image generation, video creation, LLMs, search, 3D, Twitter automation. Models: FLUX, Veo, Gemini, Grok, Claude, Seedance, OmniHuman, Tavily, Exa, OpenRouter, and many more. Use when running AI apps, generating images/videos, calling LLMs, web search, or automating Twitter. Triggers: inference.sh, infsh, ai model, run ai, serverless ai, ai api, flux, veo, claude api, image generation, video generation, openrouter, tavily, exa search, twitter api, grok
skill.summary: Access 150+ cloud AI apps through a unified CLI interface - no GPU required
skill.author: inference-sh-3

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 194 potential security issues, but evaluation confirms all are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is documentation/reference material for the inference.sh CLI. The flagged patterns are bash command examples in markdown documentation, not executable code. Network, env_access, and filesystem patterns are legitimate API endpoints and configuration instructions for the service.

content.value_statement: Access cloud-based AI models without local GPU hardware. This skill provides commands and reference documentation for running image generation, video creation, LLM calls, web search, and Twitter automation through the inference.sh CLI.
actual_capabilities: Generate images using FLUX, Gemini, Grok, Seedream models via CLI
Create videos using Veo, Seedance, Wan, OmniHuman models
Call LLMs including Claude, Gemini, Kimi via OpenRouter
Perform web searches using Tavily and Exa search APIs
Automate Twitter posts, DMs, follows, likes, and retweets
List, search, and discover 150+ available AI apps
limitations: Requires inference.sh account and API authentication
Uses cloud compute - costs depend on API usage
No local model execution - requires internet connection
App availability depends on inference.sh service status

use_cases.title: Generate AI Images from CLI
use_cases.description: Create images using FLUX, Gemini Pro, or Grok Imagine without local GPU. Provide a text prompt and receive generated images.
use_cases.target_user: Developers and designers needing quick image generation

use_cases.title: Call LLMs for Text Tasks
use_cases.description: Use Claude, Gemini, or other LLMs via OpenRouter for text generation, analysis, or coding assistance through simple CLI commands.
use_cases.target_user: Developers needing LLM access without complex API setup

use_cases.title: Automate Social Media Posts
use_cases.description: Post tweets, send DMs, follow users, like and retweet posts using the Twitter automation commands.
use_cases.target_user: Social media managers and developers building automation

prompt_templates.title: List Available AI Apps
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all available image generation apps using infsh
prompt_templates.scenario: Discover what image models are available

prompt_templates.title: Generate an Image
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the FLUX image generation app with prompt: 'a cat astronaut on mars'
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a single image from text prompt

prompt_templates.title: Call Claude for Text Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Use OpenRouter to call Claude Sonnet 4.5 with prompt: 'Explain quantum computing in simple terms'
prompt_templates.scenario: Use LLM for text generation task

prompt_templates.title: Run Async Video Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Veo video generation with prompt 'drone footage of mountains' and do not wait for completion
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate video asynchronously and check status later

output_examples.output:
Image generation apps matching 'flux':
- falai/flux-dev-lora
- black-forest/flux-pro
- falai/flux-realism
- grok/imagine-flux

output_examples.input: infsh app run falai/flux-dev-lora --input '{"prompt": "a cat astronaut"}'
output_examples.output:
Task started: task_abc123
Status: processing
Output: [URL to generated image]

best_practices: Use --no-wait flag for long-running tasks like video generation to avoid timeouts
Store your API key in INFSH_API_KEY environment variable for CI/CD pipelines
Use infsh app sample to generate input templates before running apps
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API keys in scripts - use environment variables instead
Do not run video generation without --no-wait as it can timeout
Do not skip checking task status for async operations

faq.question: Do I need a GPU to use this skill?
faq.answer: No. All AI models run on inference.sh cloud infrastructure. You only need an internet connection.

faq.question: How do I authenticate?
faq.answer: Run 'infsh login' to authenticate via browser, or set INFSH_API_KEY environment variable for programmatic access.

faq.question: What models are available?
faq.answer: 150+ models including FLUX, Veo, Gemini, Claude, Grok, Seedance, Tavily, Exa, and more. Use 'infsh app list' to see all.

faq.question: Is there a free tier?
faq.answer: Check inference.sh pricing for current free tier availability and credit offers.

faq.question: Can I use my own API keys?
faq.answer: Yes, you can use keys from OpenRouter and other providers by configuring them in your inference.sh account.

faq.question: How do I check if an app is running?
faq.answer: Use 'infsh task get <task-id>' to check status. For async runs, note the task ID from the output.
